raw_comment: I noticed that students from middle class families are at a disadvantage compared to students from high income families when it comes to getting into a good college. This could also mean that if a family member went to the same institution in the past, that student gets an unfair advantage for admission. Large institutions also take donations as part of the admissions process and low to middle income families cannot pay those.
ace_sentences: Some students are from middle-class families.
Some students are from high-income families.
A student from a middle-class family is at a disadvantage compared to a student from a high-income family for admission to a good college.
Some students have a family member.
Some family members attended the same institution in the past.
If a family member attended the same institution in the past then the student gets an unfair advantage for admission.
A large institution takes donations as part of the admissions process.
A low-income family cannot pay such donations.
A middle-income family cannot pay such donations.
